thread.title: Gov. Mike Parson expands auditor’s power, tackles veteran suicide in his last bill signing event as a governor
thread.title_full: Gov. Mike Parson expands auditor’s power, tackles veteran suicide in his last bill signing event as a governor

author: @kfvsnews
title: Gov. Mike Parson expands auditor’s power, tackles veteran suicide in his last bill signing event as a governor
text: Gov. Mike Parson expands auditor’s power, tackles veteran suicide in his last bill signing event as a governor JEFFERSON CITY, Mo. (KFVS) - The Missouri governor signed seven bills on Thursday, July 11 impacting veterans, childcare facilities, small businesses and more. This was the last set of bills signed by Governor Mike Parson as the end of his term approaches. Here’s a list of the signed bills: [HB 1495 -](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/bts_web/bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=5133528) Tasks the Missouri Veterans Commission with expanding its efforts to prevent veteran suicide. This bill requires the Missouri Veterans’ Commission to review the provisions of the Commander John Scott Hannon Veterans Mental Health Care Improvement Act of 2019 and any regulations related to such acts. After review, the commission will have to provide recommendations and make efforts to adopt procedures, programs, treatment options, aid, and other assistance necessary to assist in the efforts to prevent veteran suicide. [HB 2111 -](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/BTS_Web/Bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=7049607) Modifies powers of the state auditor This bill provides the state auditor with the authority to dig or probe any part of the governed land if the auditor has received a request from the local agency or if the auditor is suspicious of improper governmental activity. [SB 1453 -](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/BTS_Web/Bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=5706933) Designates “Dr Dan Brown Memorial Highway” in Phelps County. This bill designates “Dr. Dan Brown Memorial Highway” in Phelps County and its cost will be covered via donations. [SB 1111 -](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/BTS_Web/Bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=1572) Modifies provisions relating to the regulation of child care. Makes it illegal to establish an extended care facility for children under the age of six with complex medical needs without a license from the Department of Health and Senior Services. Services can include nursing, personal care, nutritional assessment, developmental assessment, and speech, physical, and occupational therapy. [SB 912 -](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/BTS_Web/Bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=414) Modifies provisions relating to military affairs. Provides additional college funding to soldiers to cover the gap left after federal funding so that soldiers can go to college at no cost. Also waives tax liability on bonuses given to the National Guard and U.S. Armed Forces. [SB 802 -](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/bts_web/Bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=215) “Missouri Rural Access to Capital Act,” Modifies provisions relating to business investment incentives. Provides a tax credit for certain investments made in businesses located in rural areas in this state. The percentage will be zero for the first two years, and fifteen percent for the subsequent four years. The limit of tax credits is set at $16 million. [SB 1359 - ](https://www.senate.mo.gov/24info/BTS_Web/Bill.aspx?SessionType=R&BillID=2152710)Modifies provisions relating to financial institutions. Provides that municipalities will select a municipal depository with a state-chartered or federally chartered banking institution through a competitive process. Also brings about changes in areas like establishment and operation of hospitals, investment authority of hospital board members, confidentiality of information, etc. Copyright 2024 KFVS. All rights reserved.
